snippet: LEAD: The members of the Tehama County Board of Supervisors struggled in from the blistering 118-degree heat one recent morning, placed their straw cowboy hats over their hearts, recited the Pledge of Allegiance and sat down for another session of...
lead_paragraph: LEAD: The members of the Tehama County Board of Supervisors struggled in from the blistering 118-degree heat one recent morning, placed their straw cowboy hats over their hearts, recited the Pledge of Allegiance and sat down for another session of dismantling their county government.

headline.main: Rural Counties Are Still Gasping From California's Tax Revolt

byline.original: By KATHERINE BISHOP, Special to the New York Times
